description: Primes base 10 that remain primes in six bases b, 2<=b<=10, expansions interpreted as decimal numbers.
links: Sebastian Petzelberger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
C. Rivera, PP&P Puzzle 24: Primes in several bases
mathematica: Select[Prime[Range@ 42000], Count[PrimeQ /@ Table[FromDigits[IntegerDigits[#, i]], {i, 2, 10}], True] == 6 &] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 20 2015, after _Harvey P. Dale_ at A052032 *)
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Dec 15 1999
